title: Analytics Reports
subtitle: For Landing Lion's clients' marketing campaigns.
bodyTexts: The goal of these reports is to provide Landing Lion's (LL) clients with deep analytical exploration and discovery of their landing pages. From there, LL clients' can make dynamic decisions on their landing pages with the goal of improving conversion rates.

To promote exploration within the reports I try to make each as immersive, mutable, and smooth as possible. This is made possible by performing a lot of up front calculations and getting creative with several different client-side cache layers before the view renders. Because of this, once the report is rendered, no server-side requests are made once the view is rendered.

title: Visualizations
subtitle: Interactive data info-visualizations implemented in d3. It's modular, easily imported, and highly configurable.
bodyTexts: The key difference between this visualization charting library and the current ones available is the ability able to configure multiple charts to be linked together in a specified manner. I do this by having charts subscribe to specified events on an event bus. This means charts can be configured to interact with each other without any custom code. For example, configuring whenever a region on a given choropleth has a given mouse event fire to then highlight the regions line on a line chart.

title: Asset Manager
subtitle: File manager and explorer angularJS submomdule. Easy to configure and drop into any angularJS web app.
bodyTexts: We noticed most projects we were working on required some sort of a file manager/explorer. To avoid a lot of extra work (repeating and duplicating code), I wrote an angularJS git submodule that can be easily configured and included into angularJS project to accomplish this problem. It expects support for a specific, yet standard, RESTful API.

title: TOMA
subtitle: Trackable Offline Marketing Automation (TOMA) was developed to assist Real Estate Organizations in acquiring better leads to target with their marketing efforts.
bodyTexts: This angularJS module is used to acquire valuable potential customer information. When a client connects to a website that has TOMA embedded, they are asked if they would like to see what houses are selling for in their area. If they click yes, TOMA then informs them in order to provide this information they need to allow us to access their location so we can provide metrics on houses around it. This allows the real estate agent to attain the physical addresses of leads visiting their website. This incredibly powerful information for any marketing front, enabling them with more precise lead targeting.

title: hunterbrennick.com
subtitle: Personal portfolio to showcase pieces of some projects I've built.
bodyTexts: This site serves as a personal sandbox.
Feel free to reuse any code on the GitHub repository.

title: Mental Disorders
subtitle: Did you know we lose 25 veterans a day due to Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) due to suicide? Our veterans need brand-based prescription anti-depressants to prevent this tragedy.
bodyTexts: Mentaldisorders.com is a website I built for my grandfather to help him market his book on PTSD. Read all about PTSD and the steps our government needs to take in order to solve this sad problem in Dr. Herb Wagemaker's new book, Surviving PTSD.

title: File Attacher
subtitle: Simple file manager used to upload and download patient files to onecare.me.
bodyTexts: This is a full stack ASP.NET MVC web application with the goal of enabling users to manage their files on the onecare.me site. Because onecare.me is in the health-care space the project had to be compliant with HIPAA, which means encryption and using secure networking protocols.
You will need to have a login to onecare.me community if you want to see the project. The code is available at the GitHub url provided.

title: Reliable Transfer Suite
subtitle: RTS is an abstraction layer over UDP, similar to TCP.
bodyTexts: RTS is a reliable transport layer protocol written in Python. It multiplexes using an asynchronous IO loop.

title: JOS
subtitle: JOS is an MIT teaching Operating System with a mico-kernel architecture.
bodyTexts: This project was completed for an Operating Systems class at Georgia Tech.

title: Geo News
subtitle: Existing news sites are flat, biased, and cluttered. People want to know what is happening and where; Geo News keeps you informed.
bodyTexts: Geo News is targeted at people with a demanding schedule, but still want to be in the loop on current events. Geo News does this by enabling people to quickly figure out whats happening and where.

Geo News' articles are aggregated from a variety of major news sources. To filter out the noise and show news that matters the we interfaced with facebook and twitter to get social impact metrics. Articles over a certain social impact threshold are funneled through an ETL geo-locating system to be properly placed on the map
involved: Dylan Jones, Sherman Mathews, Andrew Ford, Devon Cryts
